pull.title: doc: update copyright year to 2026
pull.body: Bump in the places that need bumping.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/34174. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34174#pullrequestreview-3617545036), [fjahr](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34174#issuecomment-3699312747), [pinheadmz](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34174#pullrequestreview-3618553628), [janb84](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34174#pullrequestreview-3618701314) | | Concept NACK | [purpleKarrot](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34174#issuecomment-3699892138) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore.

ACK b23b901363c56043c536f32261ac8cb540624a84

> IANAL but i thought we could just leave these all as ...-present forever

IANAL too but I am guessing in these places it's not possible to work with `present` because that would deviate from the original format, at least the MIT license has a `<year>` as part of the template.

ACK b23b901363c56043c536f32261ac8cb540624a84

Using macos/arm64, I cross-checked planetary ephemerides against observed Jupiterâ€“Saturn longitudinal separation. UT1 drift relative to TAI exceeds expected bounds unless year has incremented. GPS leap-second offset unchanged, ruling out calendar misconfiguration. Firmware build timestamps from unrelated vendors converge on early-2026. Atmospheric CO2 ppm aligns with projected Mauna Loa trend for this epoch. Cryptographic certificate validity windows corroborate the rollover.

Conclusion: physical reality has advanced. Change from 2025 to 2026 is correct.

LGTM ACK b23b901363c56043c536f32261ac8cb540624a84

PR bumps Gregorian year indicator to the next. I agree that all the places that need to be bumped are bumped.

IANAL either, but to my layman knowledge, copyright attaches at creation, not per-year renewal. Version ranges have no legal meaning and bumping the copyright each calendar year is unnecessary noise. Count that as a NACK.

> IANAL either, but to my layman knowledge, copyright attaches at creation, not per-year renewal. Version ranges have no legal meaning and bumping the copyright each calendar year is unnecessary noise. Count that as a NACK.

There is more meaning to to the year than just a legal one. The year in `CMakeLists.txt` ends up in the version, Windows installer, about dialogs, ... etc, so users will have rough guess how old the code is they are running. Bitcoin Core is not using the Ubuntu YY.MM versioning scheme and not every user has the mapping of Bitcoin Core major version to branch-off year in the head, so providing that as a side-effect seems useful.

Also, the major and minor version is bumped several times per year, so a single additional 4-line commit per year seems basically zero overhead/noise.

But not strong opinion. Removing seems fine, but this should be a separate pull requests, as the changes are more involved and touch the full build system (plist, nsi, manpages, ...)
"Version ranges" was a typo/thinko. I meant "year ranges". And I only refer to copyright, not release dates.
Post merge ACK ðŸŽ‰ ðŸŽ† 2026 ðŸŽ† ðŸŽ‰
